page.title: 16HARGRAVE- THE NAGS HEAD
page.content: THE NAGS HEAD is the public house in the centre of the village. It is about 200 years old. It is owned by MR & MRS MILLWARD. The pub is open from 10.30am until 3.00pm and from 6.00pm until 11.00pm. On Sundays it does not open until noon in the mornings and 7.00pm in the evenings. It has a garden where you will find some swings, a climbing frame and a see-saw for children to play on. There is a field behind the garden which is used as a camp-site. The owners also keep some animals. Round the side of the pub is an old derelict shepherd's cottage which is now used to store things in. The pub is important to the village because it is a place where people meet. We think it was called THE NAGS HEAD because it stands on land that was once ploughed by horses.
